member.name: T:Stact.Internal.StringFormatMethodAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that marked method builds string by format pattern and (optional) arguments. Parameter, which contains format string, should be given in constructor. The format string should be in -like form

member.summary: Initializes new instance of StringFormatMethodAttribute

member.summary: Gets format parameter name

member.name: T:Stact.Internal.InvokerParameterNameAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the function argument should be string literal and match one of the parameters of the caller function. For example, has such parameter.

member.name: T:Stact.Internal.AssertionMethodAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the marked method is assertion method, i.e. it halts control flow if one of the conditions is satisfied. To set the condition, mark one of the parameters with attribute

member.name: T:Stact.Internal.AssertionConditionAttribute
member.summary: Indicates the condition parameter of the assertion method. The method itself should be marked by attribute. The mandatory argument of the attribute is the assertion type.

member.name: M:Stact.Internal.AssertionConditionAttribute.#ctor(Stact.Internal.AssertionConditionType)
member.summary: Initializes new instance of AssertionConditionAttribute
member.param: Specifies condition type

member.name: P:Stact.Internal.AssertionConditionAttribute.ConditionType
member.summary: Gets condition type

member.name: T:Stact.Internal.AssertionConditionType
member.summary: Specifies assertion type. If the assertion method argument satisifes the condition, then the execution continues. Otherwise, execution is assumed to be halted

member.name: F:Stact.Internal.AssertionConditionType.IS_TRUE
member.summary: Indicates that the marked parameter should be evaluated to true

member.name: F:Stact.Internal.AssertionConditionType.IS_FALSE
member.summary: Indicates that the marked parameter should be evaluated to false

member.name: F:Stact.Internal.AssertionConditionType.IS_NULL
member.summary: Indicates that the marked parameter should be evaluated to null value

member.name: F:Stact.Internal.AssertionConditionType.IS_NOT_NULL
member.summary: Indicates that the marked parameter should be evaluated to not null value

member.name: T:Stact.Internal.TerminatesProgramAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the marked method unconditionally terminates control flow execution. For example, it could unconditionally throw exception

member.name: T:Stact.Internal.CanBeNullAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the value of marked element could be null sometimes, so the check for null is necessary before its usage

member.name: T:Stact.Internal.NotNullAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the value of marked element could never be null

member.name: T:Stact.Internal.CannotApplyEqualityOperatorAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the value of marked type (or its derivatives) cannot be compared using '==' or '!=' operators. There is only exception to compare with null, it is permitted

member.name: T:Stact.Routing.Nodes.ConsumerNode`1
member.summary: Delivers a message to a consumer on the specified fiber.

member.name: T:Stact.Routing.Nodes.ProductionNode`1
member.summary: The basic functionality of a production node that deals with evicting the message from the routing engine and dispatching it to the specified delegate

member.name: T:Stact.Routing.Nodes.JoinNode`1
member.summary:
A JoinNode with a single type argument joins the output of the left side network to the right-side network. A single type will only join to the same message that was passed through the left side network to the alpha nodes
BetaMemory is used since it keeps track of all valid activations (joins)
The unjoined messages are discarded (do they need to be kept, will right activations ever change, requiring a reevaluation of the join?)

Encapsulates a value such that only one instance is retained per thread, allowing concurrency without blocking on a shared lock for access to a static variable.

member.typeparam: The container type, to ensure proper segregation from other contained types

member.summary: Calls the specified method when a message of the requested type is received. At that point, the message is removed from the mailbox and delivered to the consumer
member.param: The consumer

member.summary: Specifies a method to call when a message is recieved. If a message is not received within the specified timeout, a timeout callback is called instead and the receiver is removed from the waiting list of receivers.

member.name: T:Stact.WcfChannelHost
member.summary: Receives messages from a named pipe via WCF and forwards them to the specific channel. Messages are first serialized to a wire type that is already WCF compliant, making it unnecessary to decorate your message objects with WCF data contract serializer attributes.

member.name: T:Stact.WcfChannelHost`1
member.summary: Receives messages from a named pipe via WCF and forwards it to the output channel. Message serialization is handled entirely by WCF and therefore requires that classes are appropriately decorated.

member.summary: Used to configure the connections to be added to an UntypedChannel

member.name: T:Stact.ChannelAdapter
member.summary:
A channel adapter is a mutable segment in a channel network. The output channel can be replaced, allowing a new channel network (built via a ChannelVisitor) to be installed in response to changes (attachments, detachments, etc.) to the network.
This particular version handles untyped channels

member.name: T:Stact.ThreadStaticChannelProvider`1
member.summary:
Provides an instance of a channel per thread for situations where the processing of a channel should be done per-thread to avoid bottlenecks
This should not be used in cases where the channel maintains state between calls since threads may change and ordering cannot be guaranteed
member.typeparam: The message type of the channel
